Key Match Events: The Yankees got off to a good start in Game 1 of this set, posting a 5-2 win.
In the Tuesday matchup, New York was up 3-0 after just two innings and ended up with another victory 6-3.
In Game 3 Thursday, the Yankees came back from a 3-1 deficit but ultimately ended up losing 7-5 in 10 innings.
On Thursday the Guardians got an epic walk-off home run from David Fry to close out one of the team’s biggest wins ever.

In the starter slot for Game 4 will be New York’s Luis Gil, who went 15-7 with a 3.50 ERA in 29 starts this year.
For the starting pitcher job Friday, Cleveland is sending out Gavin Williams, who went 3-10 with a 4.86 ERA over 16 starts in 2024.
